newsitem.title: USA: Novellus to buy Varian's thin film unit.
newsitem.headline: Novellus to buy Varian's thin film unit.

text.p: Novellus Systems Inc said it planned to buy Varian Associates Inc's Thin Film Systems business for $150 million cash.

The Thin Film Systems unit makes and sells equipment for the physical vapor deposition market, which is a key technology in the production of advanced semiconductor logic and memory devices, Novellus said.

"This move expands our portfolio of important metal deposition technologies and gives Novellus a critical mass of talent to aggressively compete for leadership in the device interconnect market," Novellus Chairman Richard Hill said.
With this acquisition, Novellus said it could provide customers with the entire set of deposition processes required for 0.25-micron devices and below.

According to industry research, the market for physical vapor deposition products was expected to grow from $1.5 billion to more than $3 billion by the year 2000, fuelled by increasing levels of device interconnection, it said.
Varian said in a separate statement the sale included the unit's manufacturing facility in Palo Alto, Calif., as well as other sales and service facilities.
Varian said it would continue to be a supplier of semiconductor manufacturing equipment after the sale.
John Chenault, Novellus executive vice president, would assume management of the new business.
The transaction was expected to be completed within about 30 to 45 days, Varian said.
